Description.author: Wojciech Trocki
Description.from: With fh-sync 7.0.0 every query filter is represented as fhsync_datasetClients that will be taken in to account when processing cloud job. In most of the cases in raincatcher queries stored as part of the filter will be outdated. We need to change timeout in sync to prevent from excessive datastore usage.
Description.to: With fh-sync 7.0.0 every query filter is represented as fhsync_datasetClients that will be taken in to account when processing cloud job. In most of the cases in raincatcher queries stored as part of the filter will be outdated. We need to change timeout in sync to prevent from excessive datastore usage.

Description.author: Wojciech Trocki
Description.from: With fh-sync 7.0.0 every query filter is represented as fhsync_datasetClients that will be taken in to account when processing cloud job. In most of the cases in raincatcher queries stored as part of the filter will be outdated. We need to change timeout in sync to prevent from excessive datastore usage.
Description.to:
With fh-sync 7.0.0 every query filter is represented as fhsync_datasetClients that will be taken in to account when processing cloud job. In most of the cases in raincatcher queries stored as part of the filter will be outdated. We need to change timeout in sync to prevent from excessive datastore usage.

h4. Expected results

Modify setConfig to include 'clientSyncTimeout'
See:  https://github.com/feedhenry/fh-mbaas-api/blob/a2636c03dbfa7c9e3bed19bf63936f71207b5fcf/lib/sync/datasets.js#L6-L9

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from:
h3. What

Related to https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHMAP-15216 . We need to be able to do:

- Allow the inclusion of session tokens from the mobile application
- Determine if the session belongs to an Admin or Mobile user.
- Return the User ID when validating a session
- Cacheing the user ID in the cloud app.
- Based on the user ID, include a filter when listing workorders etc. A mobile user can only list workorders assigned to them. An Admin user can view all workorders.
Description.to:

- Based on the user ID, include a filter when listing workorders etc. A mobile user can only list workorders assigned to them. An Admin user can view all workorders.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from:
h3. What

Related to https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHMAP-15216 . We need to be able to do:

- Allow the inclusion of session tokens from the mobile application
- Determine if the session belongs to an Admin or Mobile user.
- Return the User ID when validating a session
- Cacheing the user ID in the cloud app.
- Based on the user ID, include a filter when listing workorders etc. A mobile user can only list workorders assigned to them. An Admin user can view all workorders.
Description.to:
h3. What

Related to https://issues.jboss.org/browse/RHMAP-15216 . We need to be able to do:

- Allow the inclusion of session tokens from the mobile application
- Determine if the session belongs to an Admin or Mobile user.
- Return the User ID when validating a session
- Cacheing the user ID in the cloud app.
- Based on the user ID, include a filter when listing workorders etc. A mobile user can only list workorders assigned to them. An Admin user can view all workorders.
- Deny requests from any client that does not have a filter applied.

h3. Why

To enhance security, the filtering of workorders etc should be done on the cloud side. The clients (portal and mobile) should pass filters with session IDs. This ensures that nobody could get another users workorders etc if they know the other worker ID.

h3. How

- Update the fh-wfm-user

- Cacheing the user ID in the cloud app.
- Based on the user ID, include a filter when listing workorders etc. A mobile user can only list workorders assigned to them. An Admin user can view all workorders.

- Update the users to include "Mobile" or "Admin" roles

To enhance security, the filtering of workorders etc should be done on the cloud side. The clients (portal and mobile) should pass filters with session IDs. This ensures that nobody could get another users workorders etc if they know the other worker ID.

h3. How

- Update fh-wfm-sync to allow enforcing filter parameters for the list operation.
- Update the fh-wfm-user module (mbaas) to return the user ID + group when validating a session
- Update the fh-wfm-user module (cloud) to store the session and userId in cache

Summary.author: Niall Donnelly
Summary.to: Enforce sync filtering based on user session instead of ID.

Description.author: Tom Jackman
Description.from:
*What*
Any realm or client level role can be turned into a composite role. A composite role is a role that has one or more additional roles associated with it. When a composite role is mapped to the user, the user also gains the roles associated with that composite. This inheritance is recursive so any composite of composites also gets inherited.

*Why*
We should see if it provides benefits like DRY.

Description.to:
*What*
Any realm or client level role can be turned into a composite role. A composite role is a role that has one or more additional roles associated with it. When a composite role is mapped to the user, the user also gains the roles associated with that composite. This inheritance is recursive so any composite of composites also gets inherited.

A composite role is a role that has one to many roles associated with it. When a composite role is mapped to a user, they also gain all the roles associated with the composite role. A composite role can also be applied to a composite role, which will also get inherited.

*Why*
We should see if it provides benefits like DRY.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from:
h3. What

Following on from RAINCATCH-708, I am seeing some odd behaviour when running the raincatcher solution with the upgraded sync modules.

Updates are not always synced between the raincatcher-demo-mobile and raincatcatcher-demo portal application.

h3. Why

Before merging 

- https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-demo-cloud/pull/760
- https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-sync/pull/27

we need to be sure that the raincatcher solution works correctly locally and in a cluster.

h3. How

With the new sync framework, we need to verify that the portal and mobile applications still work.

If there are any changes needed, we need to create JIRAs for them.

Following on from RAINCATCH-708, I am seeing some odd behaviour when running the raincatcher solution with the upgraded sync modules.

Updates are not always synced between the raincatcher-demo-mobile and raincatcatcher-demo portal application.

We need to debug these issues and verify that the solution still works with the updates.

Some Issues I am seeing locally:

- Changing the assignee of a workorder and it's not getting to the mobile app.
- Progressing through a workflow and "continue" doesn't move on.
- A completed workflow on the mobile app is not reflected as complete on the portal app.

h3. Why

Before merging 

- https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-demo-cloud/pull/760
- https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-sync/pull/27

we need to be sure that the raincatcher solution works correctly locally and in a cluster.

h3. How

With the new sync framework, we need to verify that the portal and mobile applications still work.

If there are any changes needed, we need to create JIRAs for them.

Description.author: Paolo Bueno
Description.from:
h3. Why
This idea comes from the section on hoisting devDependencies to the top level from [lerna's documentation|https://github.com/lerna/lerna/#common-devdependencies]. Further explained [here|https://github.com/lerna/lerna/blob/master/doc/hoist.md]

h3. What
By leveraging nodejs' recursive module resolution we can have all dependencies at the app-level (peer-dependencies if you will).

This also allow for both easy 'global' replacements of the modules via replacing the top-level dependency, and also local overriding of each dependency by adding it explicitly to a subrepo.

The issue consists of creating a small demoable setup which might be based on the raincatcher-tutorial repos to showcase this alternative to dependency resolution.

Repository with initial code is created, some local changes needs to be moved to this repository and documentation and tests should be created.

- Documentation of the API + Diagrams.
- Observable use-cases.
- Clarification of the Approach.

Timeboxed to 1 day.

Timeboxed to 2 days.

Description.to:
h4. Motivation

In past WFM projects, handling uploading/download of multiple binaries/files linked to a given workOrder is a significant feature. A typical WFM user will be in and out of network coverage throughout their working day. To handle these events we need a queue to manage and process all items that will be either uploaded or downloaded to the cloud app.

Ideally the queue will provided;
* A simple UX/UI feature such as a cloud  

Some work already done as part of:
https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-file/pull/15/files

Description.to:
h4. Motivation

In past WFM projects, handling uploading/download of multiple binaries/files linked to a given workOrder is a significant feature. A typical WFM user will be in and out of network coverage throughout their working day. To handle these events we need a queue to manage and process all items that will be either uploaded or downloaded to the cloud app.

Ideally, the enhancements tot his module will be provided;
* Handle multiple file types / biniaries
* Provide a queue class with basic CRUD op to add/read/update/delete items from the queue
* provide API to save the queue to localStroage or the fileSystem
* Provide API to retrive persisted queue
* A simple UX/UI feature such as a cloud  providing meta data to end user on items left in queue, number failed etc

Some work already done as part of:
https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-file/pull/15/files

Description.to:
h4. Motivation

In past WFM projects, handling uploading/download of multiple binaries/files linked to a given workOrder is a significant feature. A typical WFM user will be in and out of network coverage throughout their working day. To handle these events we need a queue to manage and process all items that will be either uploaded or downloaded to the cloud app.

Ideally, the enhancements tot his module will be provided;
* Handle multiple file types/binaries
* Provide a queue class with basic CRUD op to add/read/update/delete items from the queue
* Provide API to save the queue to localStroage or the devices fileSystem
* Provide API to retrieve persisted queue and re-initialise upload/downloads process
* A simple UX/UI feature such as a cloud icon button, revealing a toolTip providing metadata to end user on items left in queue, number failed etc

Some work already done as part of:
https://github.com/feedhenry-raincatcher/raincatcher-file/pull/15/files

Description.to:
h4. Motivation

Allow to schedule file uploads in file client if there is no internet connection
Allow to reattempt connection if network connection is back. 

h4. Testing

1. Testing on browser requires mobile mode to be enabled (chrome inspector) with internet set to offline.
2. Try to add picture in files section
3. Refresh page (will have internet now) and image should appear now.
4. Check if image was uploaded to server.

Description.to:
h4. Motivation

Allow to schedule file uploads in file client if there is no internet connection
Allow to reattempt connection if network connection is back. 

h4. Testing on browser

1. Testing on browser requires mobile mode to be enabled (chrome inspector) with internet set to offline.
2. Try to add picture in files section
3. Refresh page (will have internet now) and image should appear now.
4. Check if image was uploaded to server. 

h4. Testing on mobile

1. Disable internet 
2. Try to add picture in files section
3. Enable internet and go to file section again: image should appear now.
4. Check if image was uploaded to server.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from:
h3. What 

The mobile app doesn't get the right data for a user after logging out. It displays the data of the user that was previously logged in.
Description.to:
h3. What 

The mobile app doesn't get the right data for a user after logging out. It displays the data of the user that was previously logged in. 

h3. How

- Check to see if the [$fh.sync.clearCache|https://github.com/feedhenry/fh-js-sdk/blob/master/src/modules/sync-cli.js#L1016] API is being used by raincatcher-sync.
- If it isn't then raincatcher-sync should have a mechanism to call it.
- If there is any pending updates, then the application should alert the user before logging out.

Description.author: Niall Donnelly
Description.from: All Raincatcher components should have test code coverage tools run at build tome to make sure code quality is not slipping when merging PRs.
Description.to: All Raincatcher components should have test code coverage tools run at build tome to make sure code quality is not slipping when merging PRs.

Description.author: Paolo Bueno
Description.from: All Raincatcher components should have test code coverage tools run at build tome to make sure code quality is not slipping when merging PRs.
Description.to:
h3. Why
All Raincatcher components should have test code coverage tools run at build time to make sure code quality is not slipping when merging PRs.

h3. How
Include a test coverage module to the travis build setup, http://gotwarlost.github.io/istanbul/ seems to be the module of choice throughout the platform.
Be sure to provide the output to sonarqube as it can also be used to track coverage history.
